content.raw:
I'm thinking of an easy way of explaining it. I think an image speaks much better than words:

![lookatz.png](data/bitbucket.org/repo/dg5enz/images/3455036160-lookatz.png)

`_up` is the desired direction for the camera's Z, expressed in the world frame. Here it is about [0, -1, 1] and represented by the semi-transparent blue cylinder. It isn't possible to put the camera's Z there and still keep looking (point the camera's X) at the target. So we do our best by at least keeping the camera's left (Y) the same it would be with our desired `_up`. Oh so many words!
